intro: Fagonia boulosii var. crameri, commonly known as the Desert Caper, is a shrub native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep root systems that help it access water from underground sources. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes used in xeriscaping and ecological restoration projects.
